nodes.bodyText:
I tried name = JWT_SECURITY_DEFINITION_NAME, but openapi.yaml doesn't seem to like that because the authorization pop up looks like this:
.
name = "bearer" looks like this:

This is probably because openapi.yaml is case-sensitive.

the only difference is that for name = "bearer", openapi.yaml looks like:
security:
- bearer: []
and for name = JWT_SECURITY_DEFINITION_NAME, openapi.yaml looks like:
security:
- BEARER: []

Ahh, I understand the issue now. Though this is out of the scope for the PR.

The security scheme is defined multiple times (redundantly)
The name is different from Swagger (slightly annoying)
The name is not a constant somewhere (so easy to get the case wrong).

I'll make a SEAB issue later.
double-check that the deprecated = true is actually needed and the @Deprecated is not enough for both

To put a bit more meat on this, the question is whether @Deprecated(since = "1.9.0") is enough to result in a deprecation notice in the resulting openapi.yaml or whether the deprecated = true is needed.
(I suspect the latter, but it is worth checking)
I checked and it looks like @Deprecated(since = "1.9.0") is enough for swagger, but openapi.yaml requires deprecated = true.
Also, see if you can find a responseCode String somewhere. I was not able to
I wasn't able to find a 200 response code string anywhere too
Make a private static final thing for "addZip" and "Creates a new revision of a hosted workflow from a zip"
